lines.text:
[Tula has just given a drink of "gin" to a tribal chieftain; he refuses to return the bottle]
I hate to see good gin wasted on a dried-up monkey like that.
That's not gin I gave him - - that's kerosene.
[Cookie and Tula look at the chief, happily drinking the "gin," and both giggle]
Well, am I seeing things or is this a white woman?
Cookie, I'm not going to give the girl to the blacks. You know what that means... dynamite.
You give me new trade silk. You give me many new bangles. And you give me...
Stop bothering me, it's too hot. Get outta here.
Other men DON"T find it too HOT for Tula.
Smile, ya little bush rat, smile.
With his heel on my spine, he sneered!
You know it's a dangerous game putting blacks against whites.
You're not white, Gregg. The color of your skin don't count with me. No black ever did me the dirt white man has.
